alert.note: Alert for Baca County Including Springfield and Eastern Comanche Grasslands; Bent County Including Las Animas; Crowley County Including Ordway; Eastern Las Animas County Including Pinon Canyon; Kiowa County Including Eads; Otero County Including La Junta and Western Comanche Grasslands; Prowers County Including Lamar; Pueblo County Including Pueblo; Southern El Paso County Including Fort Carson and Colorado Springs; Western Las Animas County Including Trinidad and Thatcher (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 11 at 10:42AM MDT until April 11 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Red Flag Warning in effect from Noon until 8 PM MDT Today for for gusty winds and low humidity values for fire weather zones 221, 224, 225, and zones 226 through 237, which includes all of the eastern plains of southeast Colorado, Teller county, Fremont county, the southeast mountains, and the San Luis valley... ...Red Flag Warning has been issued from 11 AM TO 8 PM Tuesday for gusty winds and low humidity values for fire weather zones 226 through 237 which includes all of the eastern plains of southeast Colorado... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 227...228...230...231...232...233...234... 235...236 AND 237... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM MDT TUESDAY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 227...228...230...231...232... 233...234...235...236 AND 237... * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zones 227...228...230...231... 232...233...234...235...236 and 237. * Winds...For TODAY: South to southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 45 mph. For TOMORROW: Southwest 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 70 mph. * Timing...Noon until 8 PM MDT Monday. 11 AM TO 8 PM MDT Tuesday. * Relative Humidity...As low as 11 percent. * Impacts...Conditions will be favorable for rapid rates of fire growth and spread.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
